revised_title: Observations of Animalcula on Duckweed Roots by Anthony van Leeuwenhoek
tldr: In this letter, Anthony van Leeuwenhoek shares his observations of tiny, wheel-like organisms (animalcula) living on the roots of duckweed. He describes their movement, reproduction, and behavior, and even observes a smaller organism entering the animalculum, potentially causing its death. Van Leeuwenhoek also speculates that these creatures may have air in their bodies, which could help them control their buoyancy in water.
